"and you also must not speak"

This is a metaphor that describes one's agreeing with a group of people as if he actually walked over and stood with that group. AT: "doing what the crowd wants" or "agreeing with the majority" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
do illegal or immoral actions that result in a unjust ruling
Yahweh continues telling Moses his laws for the people of Israel.
Yahweh continues telling Moses his laws for the people of Israel.
"You must not do actions that produce an improper legal result" that results in either freedom for a guilty person or punishment of the innocent.
In this phrase, "it" refers to proper justice, a correct decision.
"dispute"

tn.ref: I will not acquit the wicked
tn.text: "I will not find the wicked not guilty" or "I will not say of wicked people that they are innocent"
Here a "bribe" is described as if it were a person. AT: "bribe discredits ... undermines" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
"the kind of life a stranger lives in a foreign land"
Yahweh continues telling Moses his laws for the people of Israel.
"food products from plants"
"uncultivated" or "untilled"
"in its natural state" or "unused for production"

tn.ref: so that the poor among your people may eat
tn.text: The poor can eat any food that grows on its own in a field that is not cultivated. This can be stated clearly in the translation. AT: "so the poor among your people may harvest and eat any food that grows on its own in that field" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Yahweh continues telling Moses his laws for the people of Israel.
"Do" or "Obey"
"your work animals"

tn.ref: any foreigner may rest and be refreshed
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "any foreigner may rest and regain his strength" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: Do not mention the names of other gods
tn.text: Here "names" is a metonym for praying to other gods. AT: "Do not pray to other gods" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Yahweh continues telling Moses his laws for the people of Israel.

This is the name of the first month of the Hebrew calendar. Abib is during the last part of March and the first part of April on Western calendars. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:13:03|13:4]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

handed** - Here understatement is used to emphasize that the Israelites must bring a suitable offering to Yahweh. AT: "come to me without a proper offering" or "always bring an offering to me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublenegatives]])
Yahweh continues telling Moses his laws for the people of Israel.
"You must honor" or "You must celebrate"
This festival celebrated the final harvesting of all the crops for the year.

tn.ref: All your males must appear before me
tn.text: Here to "appear" means to gather for worship. AT: "All the men must gather to worship me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Yahweh continues telling Moses his laws for the people of Israel.
The fat was burned as an offering to Yahweh and was never eaten.
"the best and first produce of the harvest"

tn.ref: You must not boil a young goat in its mother's milk
tn.text: This was a magical fertility practice among the Canaanites, which the Israelites were not permitted to participate in.
Yahweh continues telling Moses his laws for the people of Israel.
"Listen to him"

tn.ref: Do not provoke him, for he will not pardon
tn.text: "If you provoke him, he will not pardon"
Here "name" refers to God's authority. AT: "He has my authority" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: If you indeed obey his voice
tn.text: Here "voice" represents what the angel says. AT: "If you carefully obey what he says" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: an enemy to your enemies and an adversary to your adversaries
tn.text: These two phrases mean the same thing and are used for emphasis. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
Yahweh continues telling Moses his laws for the people of Israel.

tn.ref: You must not ... do as they do
tn.text: The Israelites must not live as the people who worship other gods. AT: "You must not ... live as the people who worship those gods" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: I will bless your bread and water
tn.text: This is a merism that means food and drink. AT: "I will bless your food and drink" or "I will bless you by giving you food and drink" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
Yahweh continues telling Moses his laws for the people of Israel.

tn.ref: No woman will be barren or will miscarry her young in your land
tn.text: This can be stated in positive form. AT: "Every woman will be able to become pregnant and give birth to healthy babies" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublenegatives]])
to have a pregnancy end early and unexpectedly
a flying insect that can sting people and cause pain

tn.ref: or the land would become abandoned
tn.text: "because no one would be living in the land"
Yahweh continues telling Moses his laws for the people of Israel.

tn.ref: this will surely become a trap for you
tn.text: This means worshiping other gods will lead the people of Israel to certain destruction as if they were an animal caught in a hunter's trap. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
